intro: Malcolmia pancicii, commonly known as Pancici's malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
